title: Double slit - path difference - 2x fringe spacing

content.question:
Monochromatic light is incident upon two narrow, closely-spaced slits, as shown in the figure. An interference pattern is generated on a screen some distance away from the slits, and is shown on the far right of the figure. The two slits are distances of <math alttext="D sub 1" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle displaystyle="true"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="D sub 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msub></math> from the center of the first-order bright fringe–that is, the bright fringe adjacent to the central bright maximum − in the interference pattern. The path length difference for the two paths indicated by the dashed lines is therefore <math alttext="D sub 2, end sub, minus, D sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>.
The spacing between the two slits is then changed so that, using the same light source, a new interference pattern is created. In the new interference pattern, the spacing between adjacent bright fringes is twice as much as it was in the original pattern. In this second configuration, what is the path length difference for the paths from each slit to the new position of the first-order bright fringe?

choices.label: <math alttext="one half times, open parenthesis, D sub 2, end sub, minus, D sub 1, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mfrac><mn>1</mn><mn>2</mn></mfrac><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>
<math alttext="D sub 2, end sub, minus, D sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>

<math alttext="2 times, open parenthesis, D sub 2, end sub, minus, D sub 1, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

<math alttext="4 times, open parenthesis, D sub 2, end sub, minus, D sub 1, end sub, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mn>4</mn><mrow><mo>(</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub><mo>)</mo></mrow></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="D sub 2, end sub, minus, D sub 1, end sub" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi>D</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math>
